info.title: Condition Record for Pricing in Sales
info.description: Consumers of this inbound service can create, read, update, and delete condition records inside your system by using OData requests. The service contains entities for condition record, validity of condition record, pricing scale, and condition supplement.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, update, and delete condition records for pricing in Sales using this synchronous inbound service

values.text: Condition Record for Pricing in Sales

get.summary: Reads all condition supplements in the system.
get.description: Reads all condition supplements for pricing in Sales.

parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Creates one or more condition supplements.
post.description: Creates one or more condition supplements for existing condition records, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number in the payload.

get.summary: Reads a specific condition supplement.
get.description: Reads a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number and sequential number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number.

get.summary: Reads validity of the condition record for a specific condition supplement.
get.description: Reads data about validity of the condition record for a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number. Validity includes fields such as valid from and to dates, condition fields, and condition type.

post.summary: Creates one or more condition records.
post.description: Creates one or more condition records by using deep insert requests. This means that consumers must create a condition record together with validity of the condition record. Consumers do this by including the entity for condition record validity in the payload.

get.summary: Reads a specific condition record.
get.description: Reads a specific condition record for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates a specific condition record for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific condition record, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number. When a condition record is deleted, its validity, pricing scales, and condition supplements are no longer valid in pricing.
